creator: anieses
title: 5 layered African Style bead Necklace
description: This project guides you through the creation of a 5-layered African-style necklace using sugar beads and a pendant. It requires patience due to the small size of the beads but results in a beautiful ornament suitable for both saris and casual wear.
steps: Cut 5 pieces of craft wire with the following lengths: 68 cm, 62 cm, 56 cm, 50 cm, and 44 cm.
Tie the wires to the holes of the pendant, with the longest wire (68cm) tied to the outermost hole and the shortest wire (44cm) to the innermost hole.
Use a gear lock to tighten the knots by inserting the wire through the lock and pressing the lock with flat-nose pliers.

Bead the craft wires with sugar beads, increasing the number of beads for each successive layer (e.g., 150 beads for the smallest wire, 200 for the next, and so on). Secure the beads at the end with a gear lock.
Thread each layer through the multi-holed metal piece and use gear locks to secure the wires, pushing the beads towards the multi-holed metal.
Bead the remaining craft wire with sugar beads, leaving 1-1.5 inches at the end.
Lock the beads in each craft wire using gear locks.
Insert all 5 wires into a necklace cap, attach a necklace hook, and lock it with a gear lock to complete one end of the necklace.
Tie 5 craft wires of 15 cm length to the opposite side of the pendant.
Bead these craft wires with sugar beads, leaving 1-1.5 inches at the end.
Lock the beads in each craft wire using gear locks.
Insert all 5 wires into a necklace cap, attach a necklace ring, and lock it with a gear lock to complete the other end of the necklace.
(Optional) Melt any extra craft wire with a candle and stick the 5 wires together for additional safety.
